name: Catch the sheep
description:
In a quiet grassy area, they love to graze sheep. These sheep move in every direction! Use the mouse pointer, click (not too much) on the sheep, take it and take it to the place indicated on the map which is currently at the centre of the level! The goal of the game is to be able to create a place within the indicated area with obstacles of all kinds where the sheep can graze peacefully without getting lost in infinity!

****

CONTROLS WASD  Movement Hold middle mouse Rotation Left mouse  Grab sheep  Right mouse Grab objects  Q & E (while grabbing an object) Rotate object  Right mouse (while grabbing object) Put object to inventory Esc
Pause Hold left mouse (inventory) Drag single items Hold left mouse + control (inventory) Drag the entire stack

****

ROAD MAP UI / UX redesign and new features

The user interface will be continuously improved with more options and menu improvements, taking into account player feedback and new features (build / purchase)

Graphics and map display

The whole image of the game will be slowly redesigned through a new hand-made stylized texture. New animations and game situations will be added to make the gaming experience even more magical.

New main mechanics

Important new mechanics will be introduced that will complement the game, such as crafting (to collect as many sheep as possible), the basic economic system and the acquisition of experience. These will be used to make the gaming experience even more interactive and complete.

New assets and secondary mechanics

To conclude and give a further and strong impact on the game, the seasons will be implemented and the night/day cycle improved. Each season will have its own characteristics and custom assets. It will also be possible to use objects that will help you in your work as a shepherd. Seeing is believing!

****

FEEDBACK

This game is currently a really early version so we appreciate any feedback you can give. You can never give useless or bad feedback. To give us feedback you can leave a comment on this page or you can contact us directly through discord. 

If you don't know what feedback to give, here are a few questions:

  • Do you like what games look like?
  • Do controls and gameplay feel good?
  • What do you think about the base gameplay?
  • Did you encounter any crashes or bugs?
  • Do you have any mechanics you would like to get added that are not on our road map?
